heat_status: North Pacific - Continued high probabilities of MHWs are forecast across the central and western North Pacific for at least the next three months (70-90% [50-80%]; medium confidence). MHW likelihoods have also increased west of California in the coming months (30-60% [10-30%]; medium confidence). | Tropical Pacific - MHW likelihoods through April 2026 are low in the central tropical Pacific (0-10% [0-10%]; high confidence), consistent with La Niña-like conditions. The models predict the development of El Niño conditions into boreal summer, increasing MHW chances in the central and eastern equatorial Pacific into mid-year (40-70% [20-50%]; medium confidence). Western tropical Pacific likelihoods are high due to warming trends, but low if those trends are removed (50-80% [10-30%]; medium confidence).
north_pacific: Continued high probabilities of MHWs are forecast across the central and western North Pacific for at least the next three months (70-90% [50-80%]; medium confidence). MHW likelihoods have also increased west of California in the coming months (30-60% [10-30%]; medium confidence).
tropical_pacific: MHW likelihoods through April 2026 are low in the central tropical Pacific (0-10% [0-10%]; high confidence), consistent with La Niña-like conditions. The models predict the development of El Niño conditions into boreal summer, increasing MHW chances in the central and eastern equatorial Pacific into mid-year (40-70% [20-50%]; medium confidence). Western tropical Pacific likelihoods are high due to warming trends, but low if those trends are removed (50-80% [10-30%]; medium confidence).
